meanings.definition: The act of making a joke exploiting the different possible meanings of a word.
meanings.sent1: Her constant punning always made everyone laugh during class.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's punning was so clever that the audience couldn't stop giggling.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't help but chuckle at his punning on the word 'bark' in that joke.
meanings.sent4: His punning was like a colorful puzzle, each word fitting perfectly into place.
meanings.sent5: The punning in the joke was like a bright spotlight, shining on the clever wordplay.

meanings.definition: A play on words; a form of wordplay.
meanings.sent1: The punning in the advertisement was catchy and memorable.
meanings.sent2: We all enjoyed the punning in the clever headlines of the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The punning in the conversation added a light-hearted touch to the serious topic.
meanings.sent4: Her punning was like a melody of words, each note harmonizing with the next.
meanings.sent5: The punning in the poem painted a vivid picture with words, creating a playful dance of language.
